trans-unit.source: The Java client library for Event Hubs is available for use in Maven projects from the [Maven Central Repository](https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Ca%3A%22azure-eventhubs%22), and can be referenced using the following dependency declaration inside your Maven project file:
trans-unit.target: The Java client library for Event Hubs is available for use in Maven projects from the [Maven Central Repository](https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Ca%3A%22azure-eventhubs%22), and can be referenced using the following dependency declaration inside your Maven project file:

trans-unit.source: For different types of build environments, you can explicitly obtain the latest released JAR files from the [Maven Central Repository](https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Ca%3A%22azure-eventhubs%22) or from [the release distribution point on GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/azure-event-hubs/releases).
trans-unit.target: For different types of build environments, you can explicitly obtain the latest released JAR files from the [Maven Central Repository](https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Ca%3A%22azure-eventhubs%22) or from [the release distribution point on GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/azure-event-hubs/releases).

trans-unit.source: For a simple event publisher, import the *com.microsoft.azure.eventhubs* package for the Event Hubs client classes and the *com.microsoft.azure.servicebus* package for utility classes such as common exceptions that are shared with the Azure Service Bus messaging client.
trans-unit.target: For a simple event publisher, import the *com.microsoft.azure.eventhubs* package for the Event Hubs client classes and the *com.microsoft.azure.servicebus* package for utility classes such as common exceptions that are shared with the Azure Service Bus messaging client.

trans-unit.source: For the following sample, first create a new Maven project for a console/shell application in your favorite Java development environment.
trans-unit.target: For the following sample, first create a new Maven project for a console/shell application in your favorite Java development environment.

trans-unit.source: Replace the namespace and Event Hub names with the values used when you created the Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Replace the namespace and Event Hub names with the values used when you created the Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: The `sasKeyName` and `sasKey` correspond to the name and key of the Send rule you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: The `sasKeyName` and `sasKey` correspond to the name and key of the Send rule you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: With that information, you create a connection string.
trans-unit.target: With that information, you create a connection string.

trans-unit.source: Then, create a singular event by turning a string into its UTF-8 byte encoding.
trans-unit.target: Then, create a singular event by turning a string into its UTF-8 byte encoding.

trans-unit.source: We then create a new Event Hubs client instance from the connection string and send the message.
trans-unit.target: We then create a new Event Hubs client instance from the connection string and send the message.
